metadata.titel_preek: Trinity Sunday & Second Sunday After Pentecost

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God, whose inner nature is self-giving love, pursues and redeems humanity from a state of primordial catastrophe and self-destruction.

subject.identificatie: The Triune God (Father, Son, Holy Spirit)
tekstueel_bewijs: The God who pursues us even beyond the grave
God’s love spends itself to the very last drop
He shall redeem Israel from all his iniquities
to redeem his entire creation from its impulse toward self-destruction

zender.identificatie: The Triune God (as the source of Love/Grace)
tekstueel_bewijs: The inmost being of God is a dynamic interrelatedness that pours itself out
conveyed to you a measure of the love of God
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: Receiver (The hearer is the beneficiary of God's action)

helper.identificatie: Jesus Christ (Incarnation/Blood) and the Holy Spirit
tekstueel_bewijs: love that has become incarnate in history through Jesus Christ
helper.rol_van_god: God is both Subject and Helper (Mediator)

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin as a 'Vast Primordial Catastrophe', Death, and Human Resistance
tekstueel_bewijs: the depths of human pride, disobedience, perversity, and self-will
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is described not as a minor mistake but as a catastrophic power that humans cannot overcome by adding up merits.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human response of confession and worship as a result of being found by God.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer/Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: Confession is the 'entrance' or 'path' made possible only because God is already a God of forgiveness.

voorbeelden_mens_subject: the psalmist ceases to reflect upon himself

voorbeelden: things which we ought to have done
you would do anything... to reverse the situation
discovery that he is a God of infinite mercy
total inability to present ourselves righteous

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes human 'non-pouvoir' (inability) and God's 'pouvoir' (sovereign power to save).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (The Depths) to ~S2 (Honest confession) to S1 (Plenteous redemption).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Tension is resolved by the character of God (S1) who acts because of who He is, not because of the Subject's merit.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Very high; S2 is described as a 'vast primordial catastrophe'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently places God as the active Subject of salvation and defines human participation as a passive receiving or a responsive confession.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: You are like most parents—you would do anything

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as active Subject of verbs
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The God who pursues us even beyond the grave
The idea that we can add up our virtues... is decisively repudiated

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Human parents/mentors are used as 'hints' or 'glimmers' of God, but the sermon explicitly subordinates them to the 'perfect love of God'.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides this: Paul's agony is a reflection of God's agony for the lost.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and 'renewed confidence' through the removal of the burden of self-justification.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic undertones; salvation is entirely God's work.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: High coherence; the secondary program (ethics/response) is clearly rooted in the primary program (soteriology).
spanning_punten: The tension between 'miserable offender' and 'beloved child'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: God’s love spends itself to the very last drop of the blood of the Son.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides the 'fellowship' and 'grace' that the human Subject lacks.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin is an 'impulse toward self-destruction' that makes us 'miserable offenders'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a robustly theocentric narrative where God is the Subject of the primary action and humans are the receivers of a grace they cannot earn.

modale_halans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain current balance; it serves the grace-orientation.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in maintaining God as the Subject of the narrative engine while making the human condition deeply felt.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the parental metaphors; semiotic analysis reveals these metaphors function to define God's actantial role as the 'Desperate Seeker'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Greek of 2 Cor 13; semiotics explains how the Trinitarian formula functions as a 'Sender' of value to a broken 'Receiver'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'miserable offender' label is not an insult but a necessary actantial positioning to allow God to be the sole Subject of the 'Pouvoir-faire'.

appendices.notities: The sermon successfully avoids the 'Helper' trap where God is merely an assistant to human self-improvement.
